executiveSummary: David Restiano and Dr. Dan Stats from Point Pleasant, New Jersey, pitched their product 'Sore Soap' on Shark Tank, seeking $100,000 for 10% equity. After demonstrating their muscle therapy-inspired soap and discussing sales, Mark Cuban offered $100,000 for 20%, which the founders accepted.
keyDecisions: Mark Cuban invested $100,000 in Sore Soap for 20% equity.

actionItems.task: Finalize investment agreement with Mark Cuban
actionItems.assignee: David Restiano and Dr. Dan Stats

actionItems.task: Leverage Mark Cuban’s business expertise to scale production and distribution

nextSteps: The founders will work with Mark Cuban to grow Sore Soap’s business, focusing on expanding direct-to-consumer sales and potential retail partnerships.
